name: Kepler-231
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-231 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-231 is a star with 0.38999999999999974 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.49 times its radius. It is located 1042.04 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-231 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-231 b

Kepler-231 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.07 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-231.

The mass of Kepler-231 b is 3.57 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-231 b is 1.73 that of Earth. At 3.57 Earth masses, Kepler-231 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-231 c

Kepler-231 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 19.27 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-231.

The mass of Kepler-231 c is 4.65 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-231 c is 1.93 that of Earth. At 4.65 Earth masses, Kepler-231 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-231, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
